00059 /*
00060  * The DSS routines are based on patches supplied by
00061  * Steven Schoch <schoch@sheba.arc.nasa.gov>.  He basically did the
00062  * work and I have just tweaked them a little to fit into my
00063  * stylistic vision for SSLeay :-) */

00088 //int cvm_dsa_to_mod(BIGNUM *mod,BIGNUM* exp , cvm_pub_key_t *key); 
00089 typedef struct dsa_st DSA;
00090 
00091 typedef struct DSA_SIG_st
00092     {
00093     BIGNUM *r;
00094     BIGNUM *s;
00095     } DSA_SIG;
00096 
00097 typedef struct dsa_method {
00098     const char *name;
00099     DSA_SIG * (*dsa_do_sign)(const unsigned char *dgst, int dlen, DSA *dsa);
00100     int (*dsa_sign_setup)(DSA *dsa, BN_CTX *ctx_in, BIGNUM **kinvp,
00101                                 BIGNUM **rp);
00102     int (*dsa_do_verify)(const unsigned char *dgst, int dgst_len,
00103                             DSA_SIG *sig, DSA *dsa);
00104     int (*dsa_mod_exp)(DSA *dsa, BIGNUM *rr, BIGNUM *a1, BIGNUM *p1,
00105             BIGNUM *a2, BIGNUM *p2, BIGNUM *m, BN_CTX *ctx,
00106             BN_MONT_CTX *in_mont);
00107     int (*bn_mod_exp)(DSA *dsa, BIGNUM *r, BIGNUM *a, const BIGNUM *p,
00108                 const BIGNUM *m, BN_CTX *ctx,
00109                 BN_MONT_CTX *m_ctx); /* Can be null */
00110     int (*init)(DSA *dsa);
00111     int (*finish)(DSA *dsa);
00112     int flags;
00113     char *app_data;
00114 } DSA_METHOD;
00115 
00116 struct dsa_st
00117     {
00118     /* This first variable is used to pick up errors where
00119      * a DSA is passed instead of of a EVP_PKEY */
00120     int pad;
00121     long version;
00122     int write_params;
00123     BIGNUM *p;
00124     BIGNUM *q;  /* == 20 */
00125     BIGNUM *g;
00126 
00127     BIGNUM *pub_key;  /* y public key */
00128     BIGNUM *priv_key; /* x private key */
00129 
00130     BIGNUM *kinv;   /* Signing pre-calc */
00131     BIGNUM *r;  /* Signing pre-calc */
00132 
00133     int flags;
00134     /* Normally used to cache montgomery values */
00135     char *method_mont_p;
00136     int references;
00137     CRYPTO_EX_DATA ex_data;
00138     const DSA_METHOD *meth;
00139     /* functional reference if 'meth' is ENGINE-provided */
00140     ENGINE *engine;
00141     };

00143 #define DSAparams_dup(x) (DSA *)ASN1_dup((int (*)())i2d_DSAparams, \
00144         (char *(*)())d2i_DSAparams,(char *)(x))
00145 #define d2i_DSAparams_fp(fp,x) (DSA *)ASN1_d2i_fp((char *(*)())DSA_new, \
00146         (char *(*)())d2i_DSAparams,(fp),(unsigned char **)(x))
00147 #define i2d_DSAparams_fp(fp,x) ASN1_i2d_fp(i2d_DSAparams,(fp), \
00148         (unsigned char *)(x))
00149 #define d2i_DSAparams_bio(bp,x) (DSA *)ASN1_d2i_bio((char *(*)())DSA_new, \
00150         (char *(*)())d2i_DSAparams,(bp),(unsigned char **)(x))
00151 #define i2d_DSAparams_bio(bp,x) ASN1_i2d_bio(i2d_DSAparams,(bp), \
00152         (unsigned char *)(x))

00207 
00208 #define DSS_prime_checks 50
00209 /* Primality test according to FIPS PUB 186[-1], Appendix 2.1:
00210  * 50 rounds of Rabin-Miller */
00211 #define DSA_is_prime(n, callback, cb_arg) \
00212     BN_is_prime(n, DSS_prime_checks, callback, NULL, cb_arg)
00213 
00214 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_DH
00215 /* Convert DSA structure (key or just parameters) into DH structure
00216  * (be careful to avoid small subgroup attacks when using this!) */
00217 DH *DSA_dup_DH(const DSA *r);
00218 #endif
